channel.title: CVE Feed for Dell -- SupportAssist
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Dell -- SupportAssist

item.title: CVE-2022-34387|2024-08-03T09:07:16.085Z -- dell -- supportassist
item.description: Dell SupportAssist for Home PCs (version 3.11.4 and prior) and SupportAssist for Business PCs (version 3.2.0 and prior) contain a privilege escalation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user could potentially exploit this vulnerability to elevate privileges and gain total control of the system.

item.title: CVE-2022-34389|2024-08-03T09:07:16.161Z -- dell -- supportassist
item.description: Dell SupportAssist contains a rate limit bypass issues in screenmeet API third party component. An unauthenticated attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability and impersonate a legitimate dell customer to a dell support technician.

item.title: CVE-2022-34388|2024-08-03T09:07:16.261Z -- dell -- supportassist
item.description: Dell SupportAssist for Home PCs (version 3.11.4 and prior) and Â SupportAssist for Business PCs (version 3.2.0 and prior) contain information disclosure vulnerability. A local malicious user with low privileges could exploit this vulnerability to view and modify sensitive information in the database of the affected application.

item.title: CVE-2022-34392|2024-08-03T09:07:16.133Z -- dell -- supportassist
item.description: SupportAssist for Home PCs (versions 3.11.4 and prior) contain an insufficient session expiration Vulnerability. An authenticated non-admin user can be able to obtain the refresh token and that leads to reuse the access token and fetch sensitive information.
